p.i: The House met at half-past Two o'clock

speech.p: [Mr. SPEAKER in the Chair]

Order. It may be for the convenience of the House if I indicate that after calling upon all hon. Members in the Chamber to take the Oath, or to Affirm, I shall suspend the sitting until 3.30 p.m. I shall again be in the Chair at 4.30 p.m. That will be the last occasion today. Tomorrow, after the State Opening of Parliament, I shall resume the Chair at 2.15 p.m. and hope to complete the swearing-in of hon. Members before 2.30 p.m., when the business of the House will begin.
